item.title: Zeros of Harmonic Polynomials and Related Applications
item.description:
Title: Zeros of Harmonic Polynomials and Related Applications

Speaker: Azizah Alrajhi

Date/Time: Friday, October 22nd, 2:00 pm

Abstract: In this thesis, we study topics related to harmonic functions, where we are interested in the maximum number of solutions of a harmonic polynomial equation and how it is related to gravitational lensing. In Chapter 2, we studied the conditions that we have to have on the real or complex coeâ€€cients of a polynomial p to get the maximum number of distinct solutions for the equation $p(z) - \bar{z}^2 = 0$, where deg p = 2. In Chapter 3, we discuss the lens equation when the lens is an ellipse, a limacon, or a Neumann Oval. Also, we discuss a counterexample for a conjecture by C. Beneteau and N. Hudson in [1]. We also in particular discuss estimates related to the maximum number of solutions for the lens equations for the Neumann Oval.

[1] C. Beneteau and N. Hudson. A survey on the maximal number of solutions of equations related to gravitational lensing. Complex Analysis and Dynamical System, Trends Math. Cham: Birkhauser/Springer, 23-38.
